raw_text:
Based on the paper content, I'll extract the structured information following the required format:

```json
{
  "paper_metadata": {
    "title": null,
    "matches_expected_title": "NO"
  },
  "program_information": {
    "program_name": "BRAC Targeting the Ultra-poor (TUP)",
    "country": "Bangladesh",
    "region": "15 of the poorest districts",
    "target_population": "Ultrapoor households"
  },
  "intervention_components": {
    "component_a_cash_support": {
      "component_a_present": true,
      "cash_support_type": "livelihood protection support",
      "cash_amount": null,
      "cash_frequency": null,
      "is_loan_or_credit": "NO",
      "cash_evidence_citation": "TUP is a multidimensional program that incorporates both livelihood protection and promotion components"
    },
    "component_b_assets": {
      "component_b_present": true,
      "assets_provided": ["livestock", "productive assets"],
      "direct_provision": "YES",
      "assets_evidence_citation": "It focuses on developing human capital (health, education, and training) and physical capital (asset transfers) for poor women"
    }
  },
  "study_characteristics": {
    "outcomes_measured": [
      "income",
      "food security",
      "clothing",
      "health",
      "child labor",
      "education",
      "asset accumulation",
      "women's empowerment"
    ],
    "outcomes_evidence_citation": "This article uses a two-period panel data set (2002, 2005) to analyze the effects of TUP program participation on a set of household outcomes including income, food security, clothing, health, child labor, schooling, and asset accumulation",
    "study_design": "Panel data with fixed effects",
    "design_evidence_citation": "An advantage of the panel data is that we can credibly address the time-invariant household-level heterogeneity (additive) by using household fixed effects",
    "is_review_or_policy_analysis": false,
    "publication_year": null,
    "study_conducted_year": "2002-2005",
    "sample_size": 100000,
    "completed": true
  },
  "bonus_information": {
    "has_qualitative_components": false,
    "qualitative_methods": [],
    "qualitative_evidence_citation": null,
    "has_cost_data": false,
    "cost_mentions": null,
    "cost_evidence_citation": null
  },
  "evidence_citations": {
    "program_name_citation": "In 2002, BRAC implemented an ultrapoverty program called Challenging the Frontiers of Poverty Reduction: Targeting the Ultra-poor, Targeting Social Constraints. The first phase of the Targeting the Ultra-poor (TUP) program was implemented over 2002-6",
    "country_citation": "It covered 100,000 ultrapoor households from 15 of the poorest districts of Bangladesh over 5 years",
    "target_population_citation": "TUP is a multidimensional program that incorporates both livelihood protection and promotion components and features significant innovations in targeting (through participatory wealth ranking by the villagers)"
  }
}
```
